definitions.definition: containing, or tasting as if it contains, a lot of sugar

examples.text: a cup of hot sweet tea
sweet food
I had a craving for something sweet.
roast duck with a sweet and sour sauce
sweet sherry
This wine is too sweet for me.
I found the dessert a bit sweet for my taste.
a sweet-smelling rose
The air was sweet with incense.
The air smelled sweet and clean.
an overpowering, sickly sweet smell
a sweet voice

definitions.definition: pleasant and not containing any harmful substances

examples.text: the sweet air of a mountain village

definitions.definition: making you feel happy and/or satisfied

examples.text: Goodnight. **Sweet dreams**.
I can't tell you how sweet this victory is.
He played a sweet shot onto the final green *(= in golf)*.
an act of sweet revenge
His sister's a sweet young thing.
You look sweet in this photograph.
We stayed in a sweet little hotel on the seafront.
a rather sweet little cottage
What a sweet little dog!

definitions.definition: having or showing a kind character
definitions.sensetop: it is sweet of somebody to do something

examples.text: She gave him her sweetest smile.
He's one of the sweetest people I know.
It was sweet of them to offer to help.
examples.contextForm: it is sweet of somebody to do something

examples.text: He’s not what you’d call sweet-tempered!
a sickeningly sweet smile
She was really sweet to me.
She looked so sweet and innocent.

definitions.definition: used to show that you approve of something

examples.text: Free tickets? Sweet!

definitions.definition: to like somebody very much in a romantic way
to like food that contains a lot of sugar
used to say how pleasant your home is (especially when you really mean that it is not pleasant at all)
how and when you want to, even though this might annoy other people

examples.text: He always does the work, but in his own sweet time.
She just ignores all the criticism and continues in her own sweet way.

definitions.definition: to say or do pleasant things in order to keep somebody in a good mood so that they will agree to do something for you

examples.text: You’d better keep her sweet if you want her to lend you the money.

definitions.definition: what is important is what people or things are, not what they are called
pleasant but not lasting a long time

examples.text: We haven't much time so I'll keep it short and sweet.

definitions.definition: nothing at all. People say ‘sweet FA’ to avoid saying ‘fuck all’.

examples.text: to whisper sweet nothings in somebody’s ear

definitions.definition: the pleasant feeling of being successful

wordOrigin: Old English swēte, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zoet, German süss, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin suavis and Greek hēdus.
